Posts.Content: Hi I am scheduled for a mastectomy and have found out the cancer has spread to the bones including the spine. Could you let me know about your appointment with the spine specialist as the bone cancer is worrying me more than the inflammatory breast cancer. Words like spine compression, what does this really mean!
Posts.Title: Spine specialist appointment

Posts.Content: Hi you talk about nerve compression, this is what is scaring me if this is to do with the spinal cord could we end up in a wheel chair or worst.
Posts.Title: Spine specialist appointment

Posts.Content: Hi I get all my hats, scaves and very very comfortable wig from Trend Co there is a branch in Brighton and London. The service is excellent x
Posts.Title: Scarves headwear day n night

Posts.Content: Hi I'm sure your mum would like to know and will be very supportive. My mum was diagnosed the 1976 and is now 85 so there is hope for us all. Try not to worry about things, once the oncologist has talked you through your treatment plan things will start to settle down, speculation about what you might is detrimental. Go out and get some fresh air and give yourself a little treat....because your worth it....were have I heard that before big hug and smiles ::))))))))))
Posts.Title: Worried about appointment

Posts.Content: Very little seems to be know about this
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer

Posts.Content: hi I had real problems with sickness to start with until the chemo nurses started me on Emend - one 1 hour before chemo plus the intravenous sickness and then Emend for two more days after - this was amazing stopped the sickness. Try Lavido great for the loo issue and omeprazole for the heartburn. I am booked in for my next session on the 4th Jan so good luck
Posts.Title: AC Chemo followed by Taxotere

Posts.Content: Hi I drink ginger tea and lots of water this seems to help with sick feeling. Eat all the colours of the rainbow plus lots of nuts, gives me lots of energy. There are lots of drugs to help with the side effects, talk to your chemo nurses they are there help you.
Posts.Title: eating problems

Posts.Content: Hi I was originally told my tumour was 6 x 6cm. The onc scheduled me 6 sessions of chemo and it's about now about 2 x 3 which is good. I have an appointment with my surgeon next week to discussion a non skin sparing removal of the breast with no reconstruction. I can get his opinion about the chest wall. Good luck and hugs x
Posts.Title: Tumour 5.5mm from chest wall

Posts.Content: Hi Kate Love your line about dogs being your whole life. Have you read Buji and Me by Wendy Kelly. Not only is it a good doggy story but teaches you to live in the moment when living with cancer. Wendy is an american author who suffered with cancer, her dog Buji discovered the cancer through smell and she now trains dogs for this purpose. X
Posts.Title: Tumour 5.5mm from chest wall

Posts.Content: Hi I am experiencing the same sensations, also have some very sharp pains. Have spoke to the surgeon and the BCN and they have reassured me it's the nerve ends healing. I also have no feeling under my arm and down the back of my arm how about you? The bruising is still coming out so I guess it's early day on the healing front. X
Posts.Title: Pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi I had my mastectomy about 6 weeks ago. The hospital gave my a small bag to carry the drains around in. The bag has long handles so you can hang it over your shoulder. Also went to John Lewis and was fitted for a post surgery bra before I had the operation, I am so glad I did this. It helped to maintain my normal size. the hospital has since given my 4 different types of boobs for me to try out. Regards clothing....anything which is loose and buttons up the front. The main thing is that you are comfortable. Big hugs x
Posts.Title: Post op Clothing

Posts.Content: Sounds as if you are doing all the right things. Go to www.juicemaster.com there are some great juices for the immune system and cancer. I use a food processor instead of a juicer so you get all the fibre, just add a little fruit juice to make it go further. Have fun x
Posts.Title: Can I do anything to build up my immunity

Posts.Content: Hi I use getmy.com, we have made two claims with them because of the big BC. They were very understanding and paid up with in two weeks of the claim. Have a good trip x
Posts.Title: Holiday insurance

Posts.Content: Hi I would get this checked out, I have secondaries in the spine. The drug I was give is Zometa plus calcium tablets. best wishes x
Posts.Title: Worried about back ache

Posts.Content: My heart goes out to you, it will be a tough journey but you will get through it. I was diagnosed with inflammatory breast cancer last October, and the very next day my father inlaw was diagnosed with lung cancer. It was almost like the world had stopped spining. We worked through it together, compare drugs and experiences while having chemo.We called it our little chemo club and had a laugh about the whole thing. good luck to you both it's amazing how strong you can be when the bad stuff happening x
Posts.Title: Mum just diagnosed with breast cancer, I'm recovering from womb c...

Posts.Content: No worries I ended up with a box full of medicines for the side effects of chemo don't suffer in silents just let your chemo nurse know what is causing you problems, there seems to be a quick fix for everything best wishes x
Posts.Title: Ulcerated Mouth!

Posts.Content: Hi Found some PJs on line at John Lewis and not very expensive. There are some nice brushed cotton ones, lovely colours and very soft. Good luck with the op x
Posts.Title: pyjamas
